captions.text:
Farting in front of 
the family spreads love.
Omi is here!

He's a lawyer, the best one, 
in London.
What's the problem?
You tell me what's your problem?
You think this is an animal hospital?
'Long live The Aunt.'
She's his aunt.
You aren't the only scoundrel here.
Hey, babes!
Here comes the rascal!
Bloody mental case.
Have you got just one underwear?
Wear mine, not a problem.
Stop your nonsense, Titu.

Since when did you start wearing 
an underwear?
They've all lost it.
Can you handle rape cases?
We've lost the boy for good.
How do you do?
I'll give you one crore.
Get me Chicken Khurana's recipe.

You know, only grandpa knew 
how to make Chicken Khurana.
How did grandpa make it, man?
You should've asked.
I'm a doctor not a cook!

I wonder what he used to 
add in the chicken.
What will you do if you find out?
I plan to reopen the restaurant.
What did you add in it, grandpa?

I'm sure you remember something, 
darling.
Try to recall.
Chicken, tomatoes, onions and..

And what else have you been adding 
in Chicken Khurana?
Stop your nonsense, Titu.
Scoundrel!!!

The old man isn't 
the only one who left this world.
Chicken Khurana died with him too.

Keep a chicken's photo next 
to the old man.

At least today, 
stop your nonsense, Titu.

title: Luv Shuv Tey Chicken Khurana | Official Trailer

comments.text:
Agreed! Except Bollywood has always been based in Mumbai. There is a reason 
why our first public limited film studio, founded in 1934, was called 'The 
Bombay Talkies'. Our first full length film, Raja Harishchandra (1913) was 
made in Mumbai. Some believe Dadasaheb Torne's film Shree Pundalik (1912) 
to be our first film, but that too was made in Mumbai.
